016
017package imagingbook.parboiled.examples.java;
018
019import static imagingbook.parboiled.common.Preconditions.*;
020
021import imagingbook.parboiled.parser.Parboiled;
022import imagingbook.parboiled.parserunners.ReportingParseRunner;
023import imagingbook.parboiled.parser.Parboiled;
024import imagingbook.parboiled.parserunners.ReportingParseRunner;
025import imagingbook.parboiled.Rule;
026import imagingbook.parboiled.support.ParsingResult;
027
028import java.io.*;
029import java.nio.charset.Charset;
030import java.util.ArrayList;
031import java.util.List;
032
033import static imagingbook.parboiled.errors.ErrorUtils.printParseErrors;
034
035public class Main {
036
037    public static void main(String[] args) {
038        new Main().run(args);
039    }
040
041    @SuppressWarnings({"ConstantConditions"})
042    protected void run(String[] args) {
043        System.out.println("parboiled Java parser, performance test");
044        System.out.println("---------------------------------------");
045
046        System.out.print("Creating parser... :");
047        long start = System.currentTimeMillis();
048        Parboiled.createParser(JavaParser.class);
049        time(start);
050
051        System.out.print("Creating 100 more parser instances... :");
052        JavaParser parser = null;
053        start = System.currentTimeMillis();
054        for (int i = 0; i < 100; i++) {
055            parser = Parboiled.createParser(JavaParser.class);
056        }
057        time(start);
058
059        System.out.print("Creating 100 more parser instances using BaseParser.newInstance() ... :");
060        start = System.currentTimeMillis();
061        for (int i = 0; i < 100; i++) {
062            parser = parser.newInstance();
063        }
064        time(start);
065
066        start = System.currentTimeMillis();
067        File baseDir = args.length == 1 ? new File(args[0]) : null;
068        if (baseDir == null || !baseDir.exists()) baseDir = new File(".");
069        System.out.printf("Retrieving file list from '%s'", baseDir);
070        List<File> sources = recursiveGetAllJavaSources(baseDir, new ArrayList<File>());
071        time(start);
072
073        System.out.printf("Parsing all %s given java sources", sources.size());
074        Rule rootRule = parser.CompilationUnit().suppressNode(); // we want to see the parse-tree-less performance
075        start = System.currentTimeMillis();
076        long lines = 0, characters = 0;
077        for (File sourceFile : sources) {
078            long dontCountStart = System.currentTimeMillis();
079            String sourceText = readAllText(sourceFile);
080            start += System.currentTimeMillis() - dontCountStart; // do not count the time for reading the text file
081
082            ParsingResult<?> result = null;
083            try {
084                result = run(rootRule, sourceText);
085            } catch (Exception e) {
086                System.out.printf("\nException while parsing file '%s':\n%s", sourceFile, e);
087                System.exit(1);
088            }
089            if (!result.matched) {
090                System.out.printf("\nParse error(s) in file '%s':\n%s", sourceFile, printParseErrors(result));
091                System.exit(1);
092            } else {
093                System.out.print('.');
094            }
095            lines += result.inputBuffer.getLineCount();
096            characters += sourceText.length();
097        }
098        long time = time(start);
099
100        System.out.println("Parsing performance:");
101        System.out.printf("    %6d Files -> %6.2f Files/sec\n", sources.size(), sources.size() * 1000.0 / time);
102        System.out.printf("    %6d Lines -> %6d Lines/sec\n", lines, lines * 1000 / time);
103        System.out.printf("    %6d Chars -> %6d Chars/sec\n", characters, characters * 1000 / time);
104    }
105
106    protected ParsingResult<?> run(Rule rootRule, String sourceText) {
107        return new ReportingParseRunner(rootRule).run(sourceText);
108    }
109
110    private static long time(long start) {
111        long end = System.currentTimeMillis();
112        System.out.printf(" %s ms\n", end - start);
113        return end - start;
114    }
115
116    private static final FileFilter fileFilter = new FileFilter() {
117        public boolean accept(File file) {
118            return file.isDirectory() || file.getName().endsWith(".java");
119        }
120    };
121
122    private static List<File> recursiveGetAllJavaSources(File file, ArrayList<File> list) {
123        if (file.isDirectory()) {
124            for (File f : file.listFiles(fileFilter)) {
125                recursiveGetAllJavaSources(f, list);
126            }
127        } else {
128            list.add(file);
129        }
130        return list;
131    }
132
133    public static String readAllText(File file) {
134        checkArgNotNull(file, "file");
135        return readAllText(file, Charset.forName("UTF8"));
136    }
137
138    public static String readAllText(File file, Charset charset) {
139        checkArgNotNull(file, "file");
140        checkArgNotNull(charset, "charset");
141        try {
142            return readAllText(new FileInputStream(file), charset);
143        }
144        catch (FileNotFoundException e) {
145            return null;
146        }
147    }
148
149    public static String readAllText(InputStream stream, Charset charset) {
150        checkArgNotNull(charset, "charset");
151        if (stream == null) return null;
152        BufferedReader reader = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(stream, charset));
153        StringWriter writer = new StringWriter();
154        copyAll(reader, writer);
155        return writer.toString();
156    }
157
158    public static void copyAll(Reader reader, Writer writer) {
159        checkArgNotNull(reader, "reader");
160        checkArgNotNull(writer, "writer");
161        try {
162            char[] data = new char[4096]; // copy in chunks of 4K
163            int count;
164            while ((count = reader.read(data)) >= 0) writer.write(data, 0, count);
165
166            reader.close();
167            writer.close();
168        }
169        catch (IOException e) {
170            throw new RuntimeException(e);
171        }
172    }
173
174}
